article_title: 3 Ways Employers Can Prepare For The ACA 'Cadillac' Tax
article_text:
3 Ways Employers Can Prepare For The ACA 'Cadillac' Tax

Law360, New York (September 28, 2015, 3:51 PM ET) -- A push to repeal the Affordable Care Act’s tax on so-called Cadillac insurance plans has gained momentum in recent days, but experts said employers shouldn't count on it going away before taking effect in 2018.



Here, Law360 provides three tips for employers to prepare for the tax on high-cost health plans.



Don’t Wait



The Cadillac tax will be paid by insurance providers and is equal to 40 percent of the cost of health coverage that exceeds $10,200 for individuals and $27,500 for families. Although the tax...

To view the full article, register now.
